JUSTICE BECHU KURIAN THOMAS TUESDAY, THE 23RD DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 3RD MAGHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 132 OF 2024 CRIME NO.757/2019 OF VADAKKANCHERRY POLICE STATION, PALAKKAD IN S.T.NO.219/2020 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS-I ,ALATHUR PETITIONERS/ACCUSED NOS. i TO 5: 1 ASHRAF AGED 38 YEARS S/0.SHAHUL HAMEED, PANANGADAN HOUSE, THEKKETHERUVU, PUDUKKODE, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD, PIN - 678687 2 KAJAHUSSAIN AGED 39 YEARS S/0.SHAHUL HAMEED, PANANGADAN HOUSE, THEKKETHERUVU, PUDUKKODE, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD, PIN - 678687 3 SHAMSUDHEEN AGED 48 YEARS S/0.SHAHUL HAMEED, PANANGADAN HOUSE, THEKKETHERUVU, PUDUKKODE, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD, PIN - 678687 4 NAZEER AGED 40 YEARS S/0.PYARIJAN, PANANGADAN HOUSE, THEKKETHERUVU, PUDUKKODE, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD, PIN - 678687 Be bl ae ae ah ab. . ee] Bar 2024/KER/5275 Crl.M.C.No.132 of 2024 12t- 5 MUHAMMED SHAHIN AGED 24 YEARS S/0.SHAMSUDHEEN, PANANGADAN HOUSE, THEKKETHERUVU, PUDUKKODE, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD, PIN - 678687 BY ADV V.A.JOHNSON (VARIKKAPPALLLIL ) RESPONDENTS/STATE, SUBAIDA AND CW2: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, PIN - 682031 2 SUBAIDA AGED 73 YEARS W/O .MUHAMMED, THEKKETHERUVU, PUDUCODE.P.O, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD, PIN - 678687 3 IRFAN AGED 25 YEARS S/0.NASSAR, PULIYANCHODU HOUSE, SOUTH STREET, PUDUCODE.P.O, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD, PIN - 678687 BY ADV. UNNI SEBASTIAN KAPPEN OTHER PRESENT: SRI. M.C. ASHI, PUBLIC PROSECUTOR THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 23.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Pa 2024/KER/5275 Crl.M.C.No.132 of 2024 3s. BECHU KURIAN THOMAS, J. Dated this the 23 day of January, 2024 ORDER Petitioners have invoked the jurisdiction under Section 482 Cr.P.C to quash all proceedings against them. 2. Petitioners are accused 1 to 5 in S.T. No.219/2020 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-l, Alathur, arising out of Crime No.757/2019 Vadakkencherry Police Station, Palakkad District, registered for the offences under Sections 143, 147, 447, 341, 323 and 427 r/w Section 149 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860. Respondents 2 and 3 are the defacto complainant and the injured witness. 3. According to the prosecution, on 18.11.2019, the accused formed themselves into an unlawful assembly and after trespassing into the property of the defacto complainant, assaulted him and _ thereby committed the offences alleged. 4. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and the learned counsel for the respondents, apart from the learned Public Prosecutor. 5. The learned counsel for the petitioners submitted that the matter has been settled and hence the proceedings against the petitioners ought to be quashed. It was also submitted that, considering the nature of offences alleged, no purpose would be served by continuing the proceedings. Pa 2024/KER/5275 Crl.M.C.No.132 of 2024 As. 6. In Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another [(2012) 10 SCC 303], the Apex Court has held that in appropriate cases, the High Court can take note of the amicable resolution of disputes between the victim and the wrongdoer to put an end to the criminal proceedings. This view was reiterated in Narinder Singh and Others v. State of Punjab and Another [(2014) 6 SCC 466] and Yogendra Yadav and Others v. State of Jharkhand and Another [(2014) 9 SCC 653]. 7. | have perused Annexure-2 and Annexure-3 affidavits filed by respondents 2 and 3. The learned Public Prosecutor has submitted that upon verification, it is understood that the affidavits are genuine, and the defacto complainant and the other deponent stand by the contents thereof. | am satisfied that the matter has been settled and no public interest is involved in this case. There is no impediment for granting the prayer for quashing. The continuance of the proceedings will only be an exercise in futility. 8. Accordingly, all proceedings against the petitioners in S.T. No.219/2020 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-l, Alathur, are quashed. This Crl.M.C is allowed as above. Sd/- BECHU KURIAN THOMAS JUDGE Jka/23.01.24. ee ab. etn Bar 2024/KER/5275 Crl.M.C.No.132 of 2024 -51- APPENDIX OF CRL.MC 132/2024 PETITIONERS ANNEXURES Annexure 1 TRUE COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN S.T.NO.219/ 2020 OF THE COURT OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE-1I, ALATHUR. Annexure 2 THE AFFIDAVIT DATED 18.10.2023 SWORN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT HEREIN EVIDENCING THE FACTUM OF SETTLEMENT. Annexure 3 THE AFFIDAVIT DATED 18.10.2023 SWORN BY THE 3RD RESPONDENT HEREIN EVIDENCING THE FACTUM OF SETTLEMENT.
